answers.answer: Hello,Increased frequency of micturition can be due to UTI. It can be also due to excessive intake of liquids, diuretic substances (including tea, caffeine, alcohol, certain drugs), anxiety, exposure to cold, diabetes mellitus, diabetes insipidus (central or nephrogenic), urinary tract infections or obstruction, etc to name a few more common ones. I suggest you to take opinion of your doctor who would do a clinical examination and advice for needful tests.I hope it helps. Take care and regards

question: Im 24 year old male, weigh about 95kg and about 1,9m tall .Never had a kidney stone or any urological problems before.For about a year now I have been constantly going to the toilet.  It started off as only at night and before bed but now its during the day too.  Some times its a lot of urine and sometimes hardly any.I do try to work out 4-6 days a week with about an hour each day, weights and an hour of cardio alternating on different days.I try to eat 5 or 6 small meals a day and drink a lot of water, between 2 and 4 liters of water a dayI also smoke marijuana and cigarettesI have a ridiculous appetite, even now as im writing this i had a bowl of pasta half an hour ago and I am hungry again and must wait 2.5 hours to eat my next meal.I have heard that frequent urination and a large appetite are early signs of diabetes.I hope I have provided enough information.thank you.
title: I have to pee all the time!
